bf4dbd31-fd78-43a1-acb6-d9695f45cf09.description: Earners of this badge understand the role and responsibilities of an internal auditor. They have developed the skills to prepare for and conduct an effective audit. They understand and have practiced the techniques required for questioning and listening during the audit process. They have learned how to produce audit and nonconformity reports as well as how to report corrective actions.
bf4dbd31-fd78-43a1-acb6-d9695f45cf09.name: Internal Audits

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17025 General requirements for the competence of testing and calibration laboratories
alignments.description: This Standard specifies the general requirements for the competence, impartiality and consistent operation of laboratories. It is applicable to all organisations performing lab activities, regardless of the number of personnel. Customers, regulatory authorities, accreditation bodies and others use it to confirm or recognise the competence of labs.

alignments.name: ISO 9001:2015 – Quality management systems – Requirements
alignments.description: ISO 9001 sets out the criteria for a quality management system. It is based on a number of quality management principles including strong customer focus, motivation of top management, the process approach and continual improvement.

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17020:2012
alignments.description: ISO/IEC 17020:2012 specifies requirements for the competence of bodies performing inspection and for the impartiality and consistency of their inspection activities. It applies to inspection bodies of type A, B or C, as defined in ISO/IEC 17020:2012, and it applies to any stage of inspection.

alignments.name: ISO 15189: 2012 Medical laboratories – Requirements for quality and competence
alignments.description: This Standard can be used by medical laboratories in developing their quality management systems and assessing their own competence. It can also be used for confirming or recognising the competence of medical laboratories by laboratory customers, regulating authorities and accreditation bodies.

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in an interactive training course covering the internal audit process, conduct an internal audit under supervision.
Interact with other laboratory professionals during the training course, sharing knowledge and experience

a27c956f-a4b5-4407-a13f-a6e374907cfa.description: Earners of this badge have developed the skills needed to effectively estimate Measurement Uncertainty in their lab. They understand the process of MU calculation and how it relates to Quality and Traceability. They know how to calculate combined and expanded uncertainties and deal with bias in their measurement process. They are also able to communicate their process and their work to an external assessment team.
a27c956f-a4b5-4407-a13f-a6e374907cfa.name: Measurement Uncertainty Made Simple

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17025
alignments.description: ISO/IEC 17025 enables laboratories to demonstrate that they operate competently and generate valid results, thereby promoting confidence in their work both nationally and around the world. It also helps facilitate cooperation between laboratories and other bodies by generating wider acceptance of results between countries.

alignments.name: ISO 15189
alignments.description: ISO 15189:2012 specifies requirements for quality and competence in medical laboratories. It can be used by medical laboratories in developing their quality management systems and assessing their own competence.

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in an interactive training course covering elements of Measurement Uncertainty. Successfully develop a measurement uncertainty estimate for a laboratory test or calibration.
Interact with other laboratory professionals during the training course, sharing knowledge and experience.

2d24bff7-59a6-49f7-9168-d956e48cba31.description: Earners of this badge can identify and manage risks in their lab. They can apply established risk management processes in line with the responsibilities and obligations of their role. They can review and improve organisational processes, procedures, and requirements for undertaking risk management. They have learned the appropriate tools and techniques for consulting stakeholders in risk identification and used these effectively.
2d24bff7-59a6-49f7-9168-d956e48cba31.name: Risk Management in the Lab

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17025 General requirements for the competence of testing and calibration laboratories
alignments.description: This Standard specifies the general requirements for the competence, impartiality and consistent operation of laboratories. It is applicable to all organisations performing lab activities, regardless of the number of personnel. Customers, regulatory authorities, accreditation bodies and others use it to confirm or recognise the competence of labs.

alignments.name: ISO 9001:2015 – Quality management systems – Requirements
alignments.description: ISO 9001 sets out the criteria for a quality management system. It is based on a number of quality management principles including strong customer focus, motivation of top management, the process approach and continual improvement

alignments.name: ISO 15189: 2012 Medical laboratories – Requirements for quality and competence
alignments.description: This Standard can be used by medical laboratories in developing their quality management systems and assessing their own competence. It can also be used for confirming or recognising the competence of medical laboratories by laboratory customers, regulating authorities and accreditation bodies.

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17020:2012
alignments.description: ISO/IEC 17020:2012 specifies requirements for the competence of bodies performing inspection and for the impartiality and consistency of their inspection activities. It applies to inspection bodies of type A, B or C, as defined in ISO/IEC 17020:2012, and it applies to any stage of inspection.

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in an interactive training course covering the risk management process in a laboratory. Identify and evaluate risks in a laboratory setting. Demonstrate competent application of various approaches to risk management identification and analysis.
Interact with other laboratory professionals during the training course, sharing knowledge and experience. Gain insights into how other industry professionals solve their compliance issues.

732cbac9-c89f-4634-9d67-b7c5835c91c5.description: Earners of this badge have developed the skills needed to effectively demonstrate how Measurement Uncertainty is applied to sampling. They can give a detailed example of Measurement Uncertainty estimation and how this relates to testing and calibration measurement uncertainty and result quality. They are also able to communicate their process and their work to an external assessment team.
732cbac9-c89f-4634-9d67-b7c5835c91c5.name: Measurement Uncertainty in Sampling

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17025
alignments.description: ISO/IEC 17025 enables laboratories to demonstrate that they operate competently and generate valid results, thereby promoting confidence in their work both nationally and around the world. It also helps facilitate cooperation between laboratories and other bodies by generating wider acceptance of results between countries.

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in an interactive training course covering Measurement Uncertainty in Sampling. Successfully develop a measurement uncertainty estimate for a sampling process associated with laboratory testing or calibration.
Interact with other laboratory professionals during the training course, sharing knowledge and experience. Gain insights into how other industry professionals solve their compliance issues

f89f7633-14fd-49f0-a81a-b157cfbc91a7.description: Earners of this badge have been taught several techniques for carrying out a root cause analysis, including 5 Whys, scatter plots, Pareto charts, cause and effect diagrams and Failure Mode Effects Analysis. They understand the purpose of carrying out an effective root cause analysis and its effect on processes and systems. They understand how root cause analysis relates to the lab’s corrective action system. They have learned how to defend their root cause analysis to an auditor.
f89f7633-14fd-49f0-a81a-b157cfbc91a7.name: Root Cause Analysis

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17025 General requirements for the competence of testing and calibration laboratories
alignments.description: This Standard specifies the general requirements for the competence, impartiality and consistent operation of laboratories. It is applicable to all organisations performing lab activities, regardless of the number of personnel. Customers, regulatory authorities, accreditation bodies and others use it to confirm or recognise the competence of labs.

alignments.name: ISO 9001:2015 – Quality management systems – Requirements
alignments.description: ISO 9001 sets out the criteria for a quality management system. It is based on a number of quality management principles including strong customer focus, motivation of top management, the process approach and continual improvement

alignments.name: ISO 15189: 2012 Medical laboratories – Requirements for quality and competence
alignments.description: This Standard can be used by medical laboratories in developing their quality management systems and assessing their own competence. It can also be used for confirming or recognising the competence of medical laboratories by laboratory customers, regulating authorities and accreditation bodies.

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17020:2012
alignments.description: ISO/IEC 17020:2012 specifies requirements for the competence of bodies performing inspection and for the impartiality and consistency of their inspection activities. It applies to inspection bodies of type A, B or C, as defined in ISO/IEC 17020:2012, and it applies to any stage of inspection.

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in an interactive training course covering how to carry out a root cause analysis. Complete root cause analysis using a variety of techniques. Articulate the benefits and uses for various root cause analysis techniques.
Interact with other laboratory professionals during the training course, sharing knowledge and experience. Gain insights into how other industry professionals solve their compliance issues.

21fe514f-a62c-4b91-880a-ae72f063369a.description: Earners of this badge have developed appropriate strategies for ensuring their test results comply with the requirements for metrological traceability. They have learned what measurement traceability means in a practical sense by working through a test method from their own laboratory. They can discuss the interface of what the customer needs and traceability requirements. They are able to demonstrate metrological traceability during an accreditation assessment.
21fe514f-a62c-4b91-880a-ae72f063369a.name: Simple steps to Measurement Traceability

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17025 General requirements for the competence of testing and calibration laboratories
alignments.description: This Standard specifies the general requirements for the competence, impartiality and consistent operation of laboratories. It is applicable to all organisations performing lab activities, regardless of the number of personnel. Customers, regulatory authorities, accreditation bodies and others use it to confirm or recognise the competence of labs.

alignments.name: ISO 9001:2015 – Quality management systems – Requirements
alignments.description: ISO 9001 sets out the criteria for a quality management system. It is based on a number of quality management principles including strong customer focus, motivation of top management, the process approach and continual improvement.

alignments.name: ISO 15189: 2012 Medical laboratories – Requirements for quality and competence
alignments.description: This Standard can be used by medical laboratories in developing their quality management systems and assessing their own competence. It can also be used for confirming or recognising the competence of medical laboratories by laboratory customers, regulating authorities and accreditation bodies.

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in an interactive training course covering traceability in a laboratory. Evaluate documentation on reference standards and equipment to determine the adequacy of metrological traceability. Articulate the metrological traceability for a given result from the participant’s laboratory.
Interact with other laboratory professionals during the training course, sharing knowledge and experience. Gain insights into how other industry professionals solve their compliance issues.

387bfa0c-ce5f-4a87-8b47-3176d7e0b6b0.description: Earners of this badge understand the ISO/IEC 17025 Standard, why it should be used and how to apply the requirements to their organisation. They have discussed each of the Standard's clauses and their implementation and examined focus clauses in detail to ensure understanding and compliance. They have taken part in discussions on risk-based thinking and how it affects the Standard’s implementation. They have the confidence to defend their implementation of the Standard during an assessment.
387bfa0c-ce5f-4a87-8b47-3176d7e0b6b0.name: ISO/IEC 17025 Unpacked

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17025:2017 General requirements for the competence of testing and calibration laboratories
alignments.description: This Standard specifies the general requirements for the competence, impartiality and consistent operation of laboratories. It is applicable to all organisations performing lab activities, regardless of the number of personnel. Customers, regulatory authorities, accreditation bodies and others use it to confirm or recognise the competence of labs.

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in an interactive training course covering the ISO/IEC 17025 Standard, it’s purpose and implementation. Apply ISO/IEC 17025 to the organisation. Develop systems to respond to ISO/IEC 17025 requirements. Articulate understanding of major areas covered by ISO/IEC 17025 of a management systems and technical nature.
Interact with other laboratory professionals during the training course, sharing knowledge and experience. Gain insights into how other industry professionals solve their compliance issues.

712e5f0b-74fc-43b3-a2e5-72a4b107efe2.description: Earners of this badge understand the ISO 9001 Standard, why it should be used and how to apply the requirements to their quality system. They’ve discussed each of the clauses of the Standard and their implementation and examined focus clauses in detail to ensure understanding and compliance. They’ve taken part in discussions on risk-based thinking and how it affects implementation of the Standard. They have gained the confidence to defend their implementation of the Standard during an assessment
712e5f0b-74fc-43b3-a2e5-72a4b107efe2.name: Understanding ISO 9001:2015

alignments.name: ISO 9001:2015 – Quality management systems – Requirements
alignments.description: ISO 9001 sets out the criteria for a quality management system. It is based on a number of quality management principles including strong customer focus, motivation of top management, the process approach and continual improvement.

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17025 General requirements for the competence of testing and calibration laboratories
alignments.description: This Standard specifies the general requirements for the competence, impartiality and consistent operation of laboratories. It is applicable to all organisations performing lab activities, regardless of the number of personnel. Customers, regulatory authorities, accreditation bodies and others use it to confirm or recognise the competence of labs.

alignments.name: ISO 15189: 2012 Medical laboratories – Requirements for quality and competence
alignments.description: This Standard can be used by medical laboratories in developing their quality management systems and assessing their own competence. It can also be used for confirming or recognising the competence of medical laboratories by laboratory customers, regulating authorities and accreditation bodies.

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17020:2012 Conformity assessment – Requirements for the operation of various types of bodies performing inspection
alignments.description: ISO/IEC 17020:2012 specifies requirements for the competence of bodies performing inspection and for the impartiality and consistency of their inspection activities. It applies to inspection bodies of type A, B or C, as defined in ISO/IEC 17020:2012, and it applies to any stage of inspection.

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in an interactive training course covering the elements of the ISO 9001 Standard, it’s purpose and implementation. Apply ISO 9001 to the organisation. Develop systems to respond to ISO 9001 requirements. Articulate understanding of major areas covered by ISO 9001 and how these are applied in a laboratory setting.
Interact with other laboratory professionals during the training course, sharing knowledge and experience. Gain insights into how other industry professionals solve their compliance issues.
